title: How do we deal with LLC debt upon dissolving the LLC?
question: my partner and I agreed to dissolve our LLC; then he wants to turn it into a Corp while i'm opting to stay out. is this ok, and if so, how will we then deal with the money owed to me? can that be transferred over to the corp as their debt to me? right now we own it 50/50, but i've financed 90% of all our activity with no profit to date.
question_tags: LLC (limited liability company),C-corporation,Business partnerships,Liquidating business assets,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy liquidation,Bankruptcy and debt,Business
answers:
If you convert you need to be careful that you don't trigger gain on the conversion itself. That's a possibility unless you are going partnership to partnership, or partnership to C Corp.

I wouldn't do the conversion. If you want out you need to do that before he converts to create at least a bare bones marker for at least some kind of liabilities.

More importantly, converting from LLC to Corp won't put money in your pocket. Deal with the buyout issue that is your real focus and use the need for your consent to the conversion as a bargaining chip to get your buyout.

If there's no buyout now pre-conversion there won't be one post-buyout.

If the entity converts from LLC to Corp yes that "debt" should convey over if it is a loan debt (Promissory Note) and not a debt tied to some sort of profits. Be very careful here. Your email didn't really clarify what type of debt is owed to you.

You might want to consider actually statutorily converting your LLC to a Corp under CA law. Under conversion, all of the LLC's debts and assets would, by operation of law, transfer to the new Corp. If you were to simply liquidate and then incorporate, you and/or the other LLC member would first take assets in your name personally before they would be held in Corporate form, which is generally not wise (in addition, in order to actually dissolve an entity, it has to pay off all of its debts).

Thus, by converting to the Corp, whatever debts the LLC owed to you would still be owed to you by the Corp. As part of the conversion, all the llC members would get stock in return for their LLC interests. As a stockholder in Corp you could then sell your stock to the other shareholder or have the entity redeem your shares (you could finance the sale of the stock and likely take installment sale treatment of any gains, if there were any).
